brush.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: an object that you use for cleaning, painting, making your hair tidy etc, made with a lot of hairs, bristles, or thin pieces of plastic, fastened to a handle
brush.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: small bushes and trees that cover an area of land
brush.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: branches that have broken off bushes and trees
brush.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a movement in which you brush something to remove dirt, make something smooth, tidy etc
brush.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: I’ll just give my hair a quick brush.
brush.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a quick light touch, made by chance when two things or people pass each other
brush.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: the brush of her silk dress as she walked past
brush.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a time when you only just avoid an unpleasant situation or argument
brush.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: A brush with death can make you appreciate life more.
His first brush with the law came when he was 16.
brush.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to clean something or make something smooth and tidy using a brush
brush.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Don’t forget to brush your teeth.
brush.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to remove something with a brush or with your hand
brush.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Ella brushed the crumbs off her jacket.
He brushed the tears from his eyes.
brush.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to touch someone or something lightly when passing them
brush.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: I felt her hair brush against my arm.
Nell brushed past him in the doorway.
brush.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to put a liquid onto something using a brush
brush.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: Brush a little oil over the top of the pizza.
